adequateplus_pc.long_description: Adequacy of Prenatal Care Utilization (APNCU) index, also known as the Kotelchuck index, with a rating of adequate plus.  Proportion of pregnant mothers receiving prenatal care beyond adequate levels. Adequate Plus  prenatal care occurs when prenatal care begins from 1st through 4th month and the proportion of the number of recommended visits is  110% or more. The recommended number of prenatal care visits received from the time prenatal care began until the time of delivery is defined by the American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists.
adequateplus_pc.long_name: Adequacy of Prenatal Care Utilization: Adequate Plus
adequateplus_pc.short_description: Adequacy of Prenatal Care Utilization (APNCU): Adequate Plus

sources.name: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

adequateplus_pc.statement: {value} of the cases in {features.name} rated as adequate plus.

adequate_pc.long_description: Adequacy of Prenatal Care Utilization (APNCU) index, also known as the Kotelchuck index, with a rating of adequate. Proportion of pregnant mothers receiving adequate prenatal care.  Adequate prenatal care occurs when prenatal care begins from 1st through 4th month and the proportion of the number of recommended visits is between 80% and 109%. The recommended number of prenatal care visits received from the time prenatal care began until the time of delivery is defined by the American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists.
adequate_pc.long_name: Adequacy of Prenatal Care Utilization: Adequate
adequate_pc.short_description: Adequacy of Prenatal Care Utilization (APNCU): Adequate

sources.name: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

adequate_pc.statement: {value} of the cases in {features.name} rated as adequate.

intermediate_pc.long_description: Adequacy of Prenatal Care Utilization (APNCU) index, also known as the Kotelchuck index, with a rating of intermediate. Proportion of pregnant mothers receiving intermediate prenatal care. Intermediate prenatal care occurs when prenatal care begins from 1st through 4th month, and the proportion of the number of visits is between 50-79%.   The recommended number of prenatal care visits received from the time prenatal care began until the time of delivery is defined by the American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists.
intermediate_pc.long_name: Adequacy of Prenatal Care Utilization: Intermediate
intermediate_pc.short_description: Adequacy of Prenatal Care Utilization (APNCU): Intermediate

sources.name: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

intermediate_pc.statement: {value} of the cases in {features.name} rated as intermediate.

inadequate_pc.long_description: Adequacy of Prenatal Care Utilization (APNCU) index, also known as the Kotelchuck index, with a rating of inadequate. Proportion of pregnant mothers receiving inadequate prenatal care. Inadequate levels occurs when prenatal care begins in the 5th month or later or no prenatal care, regardless of the number of visits or, with less than 50% or more recommended visits received from 1st through 4th month.  The recommended number of prenatal care visits received from the time prenatal care began until the time of delivery is defined by the American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists.
inadequate_pc.long_name: Adequacy of Prenatal Care Utilization: Inadequate
inadequate_pc.short_description: Adequacy of Prenatal Care Utilization (APNCU): Inadequate

sources.name: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
